thoughts.body_text: [William] drove his daughter [Christina] to soccer practice. [Christine] and her sisters [Connie] went to the spa. [Christina], another sister of [Christine], had to babysit and could n't join them. [Timothy] and his sister, [Connie] love it when their grandmother visits because she spoils them. She is coming this week to watch them while their parents are out of town.
thoughts.program:
statement: isRelationOf(christina, daughter, william).
description: [William] drove his daughter [Christina] to soccer practice.
statement: isRelationOf(christine, sister, christina).
description: [Christina], another sister of [Christine], had to babysit and could n't join them.
statement: isRelationOf(connie, sister, christine).
description: [Christine] and her sisters [Connie] went to the spa.
statement: isRelationOf(timothy, brother, connie).
description: [Timothy] and his sister, [Connie] love it when their grandmother visits because she spoils them.
thoughts.reasoning:
From the program, we know that Timothy is the brother of Connie, and Connie is the sister of Christine. This implies that Timothy, Connie, and Christine are siblings. However, there is no information provided about William being related to any of them. Since William is not mentioned as being related to Timothy, Timothy's relation to William as a mother-in-law is not possible. Therefore, the goal statement relation(timothy, mother_in_law, william) is False.

Answer: False
